Reviews.Title: “Great Bargin”
Reviews.Author: Tamara B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with one adult and 2 kids. The room was small but met our needs. The bathroom was updated and though small, quite adequate. We were on the second floor with a view of the street and had no problems sleeping. We found a parking space right outside the hotel and stayed there until departure so no parking fee had to be paid. Breakfast was more than adequate for the price. We walked to the harbor in less than 10 minutes and rode the free Purple bus back to the hotel. The bus line stops right down from the hotel and is FREE to most sights in Baltimore and surrounding areas. A great stay for the price...will definitely stay hear upon return to Baltimore Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Room!”
Reviews.Author: JulieA08904
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3, just spent 1 night at this hotel. It was a last-minute trip, as we had just visited Gettysburg and saw that Baltimore was just an hour away, so we decided to go to the Inner Harbor and the Aquarium since we were so close! Hotels very close to the Harbor are VERY expensive. This hotel was .38 miles (or something like that) from the harbor and aquarium at less than half of the price other hotels a little closer go for. Location: 6 blocks down and 2 blocks over and you are at the Harbor. The hotel has no parking but is adjacent to a parking deck. We paid $26 to park over night. The area is not the best, but there were a lot of public safety officers on every block. Still, I don't think I would be too comfortable walking in the dark. Unfortunately, like many urban areas, there are a lot of homeless folks in the area. Our room was VERY tiny. I think the bathroom was, possibly, the smallest bathroom I have ever seen! You had to be in the bathroom. negotiate yourself kind of next to/behind the door to close it! The sink was located outside of the bathroom. The room had 2 full size beds (or double, but not queen). Bedding was okay except they use those tiny pillows that are not comfortable. But, full sized pillows for 2 people would not fit on the bed. The room was very small and I would not have wanted to spend more than one night here with the 3 of us in one room. Breakfast was typical for a "free" breakfast...egg and sausage, make your own waffles, bread and muffins, cereal/oatmeal packets, coffee, tea, juice. It was as expected. I would probably stay here again just for the price, but only if it was an overnighter.

Reviews.Title: “quite run down, dusty and dirty”
Reviews.Author: brebr
Reviews.Content: the hotel and the rooms are quite run down, dusty and dirty: hairs on the sheets and towels, dust all around the room, dirty windows and carpets, a dirty shower curtain and so on. we were not satisfied at all and commented at the front desk - but the person there just said "sorry" without any further apologies or efforts. inacceptable. we paid a 115 usd which is definitely overpriced though the localisation is good.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: msfromgptx
Reviews.Content: A little funky, but a great value. Was clean and quiet. The roomer are a little small. Fitness area is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Like this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brandon K
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night att he nearby Best Western property (also very good)..but had to mve over to this Hotel because they were full. this Quality Inn was one of the better ones that I have stayed at. Great location, easy walk to the Harbor area, and the employees were all very nice. I will stay here again when I need a Hotel in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.........”
Reviews.Author: Firecapt3419
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable place to stay while in Baltimore. The room are a little small, but the property is well kept and the staff is very professional and accomdating. If you drive I would recommend you park in the city garage one hslf block away. The garage is secure(Need you parking ticket to enter) and has video camera's. This was our second stay at this hotel and have enjoyed both times.

Reviews.Title: “All you can realistically expect”
Reviews.Author: FlyingToast
Reviews.Content: Look...it's a Quality Inn. Comfortable beds, decent sized room, pretty nice bathroom, staff was friendly and helpful, free basic breakfast, and it's well-located for both the Harbor and downtown. If that sounds like what you need, you should give it a whirl as long as the price is reasonable (generally $100 or less if you shop around online). If you need an elaborate business center or a huge workout facility or ballrooms, you're gonna have to cough up 2-3 times as much. That's pretty much the deal.

Reviews.Title: “affordable luxury in baltimore”
Reviews.Author: amishboy
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Quality Downtown Baltimore on Nov 1st 2011 and I must say this property is a winner. Yes the rooms are on the smaller side but they do have a very luxurious feel to them. The bedding was just perfect with clean crisp sheets and thick comforter. The bathrooms were all updated with glass sinks,ceramic tile and great working tub/shower combo. Also included in the room is flat panel television, soft lighting but still enough for reading or working, free wifi and new carpet. The contenential breakfast buffet did the trick to get your day started. The location of this Quality Inn is not far from the Inner Harbor and all that baltimore has to offer. The front desk staff was attentive to guests needs and very friendly when engaged in conversation. The kicker here is that the room rates are well below any of the other chain hotels in the area. When in Baltimore give this Quality Inn a try. You won't be sorry you did.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good Value!”
Reviews.Author: ab1966
Reviews.Content: THE QI Downtown Baltimore is in the city center and walking distance to the convention center. Parking garage is right next to the hotel, making it a good option for travelers with own vehicle. The lobby is a bit dated but ok. The staff is very helpful. The rooms are on the small side but clean. The decor is a bit strange with a combination of classic and modern. Walking distance on Charles Street are numerous small restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel far exceeds expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki S
Reviews.Content: A group of girlfriends and I were in Baltimore celebrating a birthday and booked this hotel. We chose it because we are Choice Rewards cardholders and the location seemed like it was perfect--close to the Harbor, yet decent priced. Like most other reviews, this Quality Inn had to be one of the nicest we have stayed at. The rooms looked good, the bathrooms were phenomenal and the breakfast was tasty! The only drawback we had was the actual layout of the room was kind of small and cramped, especially for 4 women traveling for the weekend! What made this Quality Inn stand out from the others we have stayed at was the staff, in particular, Raymond. Raymond greeted us warmly from the moment we arrived and was eager to assist us with places to go. Being that we were celebrating a birthday, we wanted to hit some hot spots and he gave us some great suggestions that were all within walking distance of the hotel. He gave us directions on how to walk to the Inner Harbor and even pointed us in the direction of the hot spots there, too! His recommendation of Mo's Seafood & Pasta in Little Italy for excellent dining was spot-on and the best part..they provided a shuttle to and from the restaurant! We had a fabulous time the entire weekend and thanks to Raymond, we didn't waste valuable time trying to find good places to eat and drink at! Excellent hotel that I wouldn't hesitate staying at again or recommending to friends looking to travel to Baltimore. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: branguertin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my way through from PA. This Quality Inn was nicer than most I have stayed in, and can't beat the location. A lot of others in Baltimore were very high priced, and this one was a much better deal, location, and seemed to offer everything that I needed while visiting the city. Quick walk to the Inner Harbor area as well. I will stay here next time I'm in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Getting better--and a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: ForestHansen
Reviews.Content: In the past, this hotel has had mixed reviews. I think they must have done some major redecorating. At least our room seemed newly redone, with stylish fixtures in the bathroom, new wallpaper. and other improved amenities (TV, coffee maker, etc.). Quite a decent breakfast as well. Surely it's the best bargain in downtown Baltimore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all!”
Reviews.Author: martson
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel, the front desk associate Raymond was engaged in a long conversation with what seemed to be his friend and not a guest of the hotel. I waited in line for about 15 minutes before he realized that I was getting impatient and wanted to check in. His attitude suggested that I disturbed him. So when he finally started to check me in, I explained to him that this was very last minute stay and I forgot my wallet at my office in DC ( I work at the State Department). I had my government ID and I explained to him that I was going to pay for the room in full with cash. I've stayed at other hotels and I know about credit card holds, so I asked him would he require a hold on my credit card when he asked (this is an old card that I barely use). He said no so I gave it to him and the cash for the room. He checks me in but before giving me my keys, he explains to me that my credit card was declined and that he either needed additional cash or another card. I told him that I asked him before making the authorization did he need a hold and I reminded him of how he said no. We went back in forth for another 15 mins and I asked him how much additional for incidentals ( most limited service hotels only require about $50 so I was prepared to do that) and he said a whopping $100! So you want me to give you $200 for a flea bag hotel and there is no way to incur incidentals anyway??? ---hotel has no minibars, you don't have the option of putting parking on your room, can't order movies, and there is no room service. I ended up walking right out and checking in at the Hampton Inn on Redwood. Not only was the manager on duty empathic to my situation, but he was very accomdating and within minutes I had my key and was ready to go and for that I have officially become a Hampton Inn fan. There were no homeless people walking around outside of the hotel. The staff was very attentive, available, and provided great service. Overall, I'm so mad I wasted my time and energy trying to stay at this FLEA BAG HOTEL. I will make it a point to let everyone that I know about this and hopefully they won't waste their hard earned money on such poor service. Baltimore is full of great hotels and this one just isn't it. Before working in the government, I worked for Hyatt, Walt Disney World, and Ritz Carlton so I know hospitality inside out....no this hotel is not a 4 star hotel, but service is what sets you up to compete with other brands and it costs nothing!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodRobert
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous. The price was reasonable. The hotel was reasonably clean. We had a few bumps in the road. The closet in the room was small and had a broken hinge which made using it pointless. We had two phones in the room and neither worked. We reported this to the front desk and were told someone would fix the problem. No one came to fix the problem during our stay. The air conditioning would not cool below 73 degrees but most of our stay it was closer to 80 degrees in the room. We reported this to the front desk and maintenance did come and reset the thermostat. This did not fix the problem and there was no follow up by maintenance to see if the problem was resolved. The front desk staff was polite but upon our check out did not question whether we enjoyed our stay or not. The price was good but if I were to stay here again I would definitely insist that the basic room functions work appropriately without question. The website indicates that this was a brand new hotel in 2009 but it seemed more like a made over hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the lobby fool you.”
Reviews.Author: 91csedg
Reviews.Content: When I first walked in and saw the out dated lobby, and somewhat dirty, I got a little discouraged. But the staff was exceptionally nice. And showed no frustration dealing with out of towners when we asked 'tourists' questions. After we got on the elevators everything went up from there (pun intended). The hall ways were nice and clean. The room was great. The door was a large, heavy, wooden door which made us feel very protected. Everything was very very clean. You could definitely notice that they put a lot of care and effort into making you have the best stay as possible. I appriciate the very nice, safe, and clean stay. Will be returning :)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jbirdU2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. The lobby, the stairway and the hallways are dirty and outdated. It needs more than just a coat of paint. The whole hotel smells musty. The rooms were small and were in better shape than the rest of the hotel, but still not worth the money. The location is not good either. You can walk to the inner harbor, which was it's selling point for my family, but my family did not feel safe there.

Reviews.Title: “No problems. Nice price.”
Reviews.Author: morganhomer
Reviews.Content: One night. Very small rooms with slippery bathroom floors. Clean. Comfortable. Don't expect much from breakfast. Half the price of hotels a bit closer to the Harbor, but no problem walking down to all the attractions. Walked back late (after the U2 show) with no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: VLucius582
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I didn't get bed bugs after staying my 1 night so I was quite happy. The location is awesome. Walked to the bars on the Inner Harbor and then on to the game at Camden Yards. Came back to the hotel after 1am and was not accosted by any vagrants or hobos. Check-in @ 5pm was really easy. I left @ 6am to head back to NJ for work and grabbed some complimentary yogurts and muffins on the way out. Parking around the corner somehow cost me less than five bucks for the night. I forgot to set the thermostat before falling asleep so the room was pretty hot. The room was clean. Beds were reasonably comfortable, and after tearing them apart upon arrival, found that they were w/out bed bugs. I was initially going to stay at a "nicer" hotel until i checked http://www.bedbugreports.com/city/md-baltimore and found the place listed as having had a recent incident. Overall I was pleasantly surprised and would stay again to catch a ball game.

Reviews.Title: “Consider a different hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MrsAllie
Reviews.Content: LOVE the Inner Harbor area in Baltimore, but the Quality Inn was questionable. I guess it's a good value for the the price, but the rooms are TINY and not the cleanest & they should fire whoever decorated the rooms. The bathroom door grazed the toilet everytime you opened the door and the bathroom was the size of a shoebox. They put in a new sink which leaked the 1st time we turned it on. There was a WEIRD painting above the bed of a fat kid holding a scary doll...not sure about that. Within walking distance (less than a mile) of Inner Harbor, but so are other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: skeele
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's proximity to Baltimore Harbor (only a few blocks away-walking distance). Although there is no onstreet parking, the parking garage was on the next block and very secure. The hotel is a beautiful historic building, our room was small but very updated in style and clean. The staff (notably Raymond), but all of them were very friendly and helpful to first-time visitors to their city. Would recommend staying here and we certainly will again on our next trip to the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK small rooms old building with smell”
Reviews.Author: Tikisha
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the hotel was hard to find the sign is not easy to see and we passed it a few times. Upon checkin there was a woman who looked sick laying on the couch in the lobby sleeping and the man behind the desk was rude and obnoxious he kept complaining about management. He was not helpful with the location of parking and I had to find it on my own. 1 adult and 2 teenagers in a double bedroom and it was a tight fit, the bathroom was large because we were in a handicap accesible room but overall it was small. The lobby has a smell that we could not explain but it was not pleasant. I felt as though the hallways and basement area where the meeting rooms and gym is located is old even though the rooms are more updated. On Sunday the 24 hour gym was located at 11am until 2pm due to luggage storage with no prior notice. Breakfast was fresh fruit, cereal, donuts, bread, eggs, sausage, juice and coffee. We were in town for an event at the convention center and between parking at the hotel and the convention center for a Sat - Mon stay I spent about $52 in parking. Parking at 210 St Paul was $15 for 11 hours, and $7.75 on Fayatte if you park after 4pm and out by 9am. The convention center is walkable but not reccommended there were people hanging outside the hotel all hours of the day and/or night. There is a deli market next to the hotel that has sandwiches, drinks, chips etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ranuvishal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Quality Inn from March 15 - March 18. I was on the business trip. The hotel is small but good for short stay. It's on the road so is little noisy and restaurants around the hotel can make the life easier for business travellers. The Inner harbor is quite near and at a walking distance. The breakfast served in the morning is filling and good. Regards Vishal

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and cheap, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: katm79
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the price. With AAA, one night was less than $70. Only a few blocks from Inner Harbour or Mount Vernon, located in a nice area. The room was Very clean and the staff was friendly and accommodating. If you are on a budget and do not plan to spend much time in the room, it is perfect. I would suggest that you ask for a room on an upper floor. We stayed on the second floor and between street traffic and other guests, it was very noisy. The air/heat was extremly loud each time it turned on. I eventually shut it off altogether. Maybe because the vent was right over the bed and the room was tiny. I had a 1 Queen bed room which comprised the bed and a bathroom, and a door - no space. The FREE breakfast very nice and again very clean, with eggs and sausage in addition to the regular stuff. If you just need a room to crash in and looking to save money, this would be a good choice. Try to get a higher floor though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but....”
Reviews.Author: Elman1952
Reviews.Content: We decided to take an overnight trip to Baltimore and wanted to stay downtown for convenience of location. We drove to the hotel and parked in the lot recommended by the hotel (they do not have their own parking). Parking was $15/night, even though the hotel website said it was $13/night. We walked to the hotel to check in. The process took about 10 minutes because the desk clerk didn't seem to be familiar with the discounted, paid in advance, booking we had made. After getting our key cards, we went to the room. It was very small, which was not surprising for an old city hotel, and the room was very well appointed due to the recent renovation. Unfortunately, that was the only good thing about our stay. 1. Our key cards never worked again. 2. After being told the bar was open for happy hour, I went down to have a cocktail before dinner and discovered the bar tender had just "stepped away". When I asked a waitress to serve me, she said she was too sick to pour me a drink. This was during "happy hour." I went down the street to the Tremont and was treated like a king. 3. When we returned to our room after our evening out, we discovered the air conditioner was so loud that we could hardly sleep. Great location, but the staff needs to be brought up to a much higher standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, cheap”
Reviews.Author: C-VilleDog
Reviews.Content: Traveled in for business. The hotel is well located - walking distance to Inner Harbor, courts, and Mt. Vernon Square. Charm City Connector stops right in front (purple line). Clean rooms, free Internet. Breakfast buffet a little lacking, but the price is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose...”
Reviews.Author: rjkcpktrips
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent one night at the Quality Inn Downtown Batimore because we were attending something at the Convention Center. The hotel said it was .3 miles away, but it was a little further walk. As previously stated, parking is not on-site, but 15.00 a day is reasonable in a major city, you need to carry your belongings a block. All the staff I encountered were very friendly during our stay. The room was clean but small. We had a room with two queen beds and you could barely move the chair at the desk. The bathroom was a decent size though. The beds were comfortable. The free wi-fi worked fine in our room. The TV on the other hand did not carry ESPN which was not good. Very limited channels on TV. Not too many places to eat directly around the hotel, but you could walk down towards Pratt Street as there are many places down there. The continental breakfast the next day was bare bones. Toast, cereal, and bagels. It was fine. Overall, the staff was nice, the location was ok, and the room was ok. We stayed at another hotel that weekend (booking issues) and liked it better. I would stay here again, but look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect for overnight stay to look at universities”
Reviews.Author: RandyLJackson
Reviews.Content: My son and I were in Baltimore to look at universities and needed an inexpensive place to stay for one night before we were off. Althought the hotel was in walking distance of the inner harbor - it was a healthy walk. Ms. Jackson greeted us at the desk and she was most helpful in helping us get transportation and to give us information about the area and schools. Our room was a bit small but we just used it to sleep. Television was hooked up to a satellite so when a storm came through we couldn't watch tv at night. The free wifi didn't work - we could connect but it wouldn't let us open the internet. A little inconvenient but we made do with the business room that they had. For the price it was great and the service of Ms. Jackson made all of the other quirks palatable.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cotutschka
Reviews.Content: Our first room at this hotel was gross-fingernail clippings on the nightstand, hair of a certain type in the bathroom, burnt matches on the desk. We asked for a room change, which we did receive, and while the second room was cleaner, I wouldn't say it was amazingly better. The rooms are remodeled, but I would rather have an old hotel that is clean than a new one that isn't. The rooms have taken some beatings: I am just guessing that this low-cost hotel is a base for a lot of people who are going out downtown. The breakfast was cereal, yogurt, pre-packaged baked goods, and some hard-boiled eggs. I felt sorry for the foreigners who were using the hotel as their base to explore Baltimore, because I overheard snippets of their unhappiness with the breakfast in general. There is also a club on the first floor, which is something to consider-if you want to go out all night and party, great, but if you want to sleep, stay away from the floors immediately above it! In addition, the service at the front desk was not very helpful, and we overheard a heated exchange between the hotel staff and another guest who was unhappy with their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a night (or more) downtown”
Reviews.Author: h1joly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel has been renovated is very modern inside. Our room was very small, but we only had a king, so for two people, there was plenty of room. The hotel is short on "fancier" amenities that you would find at other, more expensive, downtown hotels (ex: no room service, though there is FREE wi-fi), but is clean, comfortable, nicely decorated and in a terrific location. It's about a ten minute walk down St. Paul/Light St to the inner harbor, and maybe 15 minutes to Oriole Park. Since we only stayed one night, we didn't experience any housekeeping, but check in and out was smooth and the front desk was able to give directions and recommendations for restaurants. Another review commented about loiterers asking for money out front--nobody asked me for money, but, um, it's the city and it's downtown, what do you expect? Overall, we would (and probably will) definitely stay here again. It's a great place to crash after an O's game, or as a home base for a weekend at the Inner Harbor. Two major downsides: there is no free parking (the garage a block away was $15 for a 24-hour period); and there is no place to park temporarily in front of the hotel for check in. In front of the hotel, there is a "no stopping zone" until after 7pm. We solved this by leaving my husband pulled over on Lexington while I checked in and got directions to the closest garage. Not a big deal, but something to consider. Another tip: our "view" was a roof and the three outside walls of the hotel. If we came back, I would request a room with a street view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: lostboydp
Reviews.Content: Was able to get a decent rate for Fri/Sat stay in the Baltimore downtown. Only a couple blocks to the Inner Harbor, so very nice walk in good weather or a cheap (under $5) cab ride. Check in was quick, and the front desk clerks seemed friendly. It's an older hotel, but in really good shape. The room itself was clean with a decent layout and plenty of room. The bathroom has definately been modernized not too long ago. There was some street noise from traffic, but we were able to sleep well. There is a business area off the lobby with 3 PCs you can use for free. And they have free continental breakfast. I will definately look here again when coming back to Baltimore. Great location, and good price for a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good on "Genuine hospitality"”
Reviews.Author: CasaSulo
Reviews.Content: The façade of this hotel is really impressive, but do be careful not to park immediately in front because your car will be towed away. However, there is a side road to park for loading and off loading your luggage and a local car park is available for use. The receptionist was helpful in responding to any questions but did not volunteer any information and nobody there to assist with luggage. The first room we were given stank of stale cigarette smoke and as soon as we phoned reception she apologized and put us into another room, 608, which was fine, but with a little bit more thought at the planning stage and the bed moved towards the doorway another foot, the space around it and the desk area would have been easier to use. The room itself had everything in it including free high speed wi-fi, it was just that it was all crammed in. The use of side lights everywhere makes the opposite side of the room quite dark and the bathroom looked something out of Homes and Gardens, very neat, very stylish but we really wouldn’t like to be the housekeeper cleaning the place. One downside though, was the lack of a loo brush. We don’t understand the modern idea of hoteliers not putting one in the bathroom. Do they really think it's unhygenic or that people will steal them? The coffee in both our room and the breakfast area was appalling. Even though it was "freshly percolated" in our room - it was the cheapest! Talking about the courtesy breakfast, once again sadly it was barely adequate, totally self service with a few rounds of bread for toast, a couple of bagels and muffins and a selection of jams etc. and not eco friendly at all with everything in plastic or polystyrene. On arrival back in our room, we were horrified to discover a man there speaking no English, dressed in jeans, a jacket and woolly hat. We asked him what he was doing there and he just took out of his pocket a pass card and proceeded to pick up towels off the floor and said “cleaning”. This obviously wasn’t adequate explanation for us as somebody had entered our room where all our personal effects were on show waiting to be packed, so we phoned to reception and asked for security immediately. They phoned back some three minutes later to say the General Manager was on his way up. He listened to our grievance and explained that the man was indeed an employee of the hotel, was being trained, and whoever was training him hadn’t given him proper instruction on when to enter a room, dress code and he – the Duty Manager – would deal with the situation personally. On check out we were given a 25% reduction for “inconvenience” and “distress”. We didn’t pursue the matter further but feel that they got off extremely lightly considering it was their lack of training for a new employee who was just doing his best.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: onsabbatical
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located and within walking distance of Baltimore's attractions. The staff was friendly and responded quickly to requests. The room was small and contained essential amenities but was clean and confortable. There was a quarter-sized hole in the door where an ornamental knob should have been which was a little concerning (I taped it up rather than trying to change rooms). The cost of the room, while at a discount, was still slightly more expensive than I would have expected, but seemed to be a bargain for the area. It was a little scary to be out around the neighborhood at night but was fine during the day. There were a variety of restaurants within walking distance ranging from fast food to fine dining, which was great. All in all, a decent "budget" place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But No Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: jstefaniak
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, the staff was great, and it was located within walking distance of all attractions! I booked my hotel on HOTELS.COM, which was a mistake! I booked for $143 and the hotel rates were only $89.99 for the 2 nights I was there... so I got screwed! There is also no free parking. I had to park on a parking ramp for 2 days which cost me nearly $40!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Gem”
Reviews.Author: hotmama1127
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to surprise me with an overnight stay at this hotel for our anniversary and so far, this is the best gift he has given me to date. The rooms were beautiful with a whirlpool tub and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and even wished us a happy anniversary which I thought was very thoughtful of them. The hotel does have a spa also which I must admit was a very nice touch considering it was a small getaway for us and this was a bonus! We are already planning on coming back next year for our anniversary and maybe if we are lucky some other weekend escapes in between. The location of the hotel was perfect for us as it was close enough to downtown that we could get there very easily but also enough distance away that we did not have to deal with typical big city traffic. Again, a very nice place to stay and I can't wait to head back again for some more rest and relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean....But”
Reviews.Author: sheilaontheraod
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean & comfortable, only had the chance to meet 2 of the hotel staff and although they were friendly it could have been disasterious had my husband not followed up in the early hours of the morning we were supposed to catch our flight. We had asked for a wake up call at 4:30am and a taxi for 5:45, we did not get our wake up call and my husband had set the alarm on his cell phone (just in case) he went down to the desk to make sure they had arranged for the taxi and the morning clerk had no idea of a taxi request. We found out that the telephones in the room did not even work. If you do decide to stay here I recommend you make your own arrangements and not leave it up to the hotel staff. It's also very inconvenient parking for checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: jgjelly
Reviews.Content: The staff was very courteous during check-in and our room was ready when we arrived (around 3:00pm). The lobby is gorgeous with big windows and comfy furniture. The room was small but pretty and very clean. Not great if you plan on spending a lot of time cooped up in the room, but perfectly comfortable for sleeping and spending a couple of hours relaxing mid-day. The heavy drapes kept out the bright lights and there was not an extensive amount of city noise during the night. The breakfast was good; cereal, bagels, fruit and yogurt. The hotel was a few short blocks from the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. A great location for the price! We utilized Express Check out which was a breeze. We were even allowed to check our bags behind the desk for the day since our flight wasn't until 9:00 that night. Once we returned to the hotel (after we were technically no longer guests mind you) to pick up our bags we were allowed to sit in the lobby and watch tv while we waited for our airport shuttle. A great value and a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: yuninok
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove down to Baltimore for an overnight crab filled excursion from NY. We did not want to spend a lot of money so this place was the best place for us. We are very simple people who were looking for a bargain. Take that as the mindset when reading my review: First, location, not in the best part of Baltimore, but certainly not the worst. I actually think I drove through the worst part of Baltimore when trying to find this place. St. Paul St turns into Light Street by Inner Harbor, so it's just a simple 10 minute walk to everything by the Harbor. We walked during the day from the hotel to the harbor with no problems. There are a lot of office building lining this block, so I felt pretty safe. However, we walked back at night and of course all of the building were closed so there wasn't as much pedestrian traffic. I didn't feel totally safe, but safe enough to walk back to the hotel. We saw several homeless people, but that's about it. Check-in: No problem here, but of course this is on a case to case basis. We arrived on a Wednesday but we arrived at noon and they had a room for us (2pm checkin time) Parking: There is none, and you have to pay. Good thing is that the parking garage next door is relatively safe. No problems parking my car here overnight. Also, there is no dedicated drop-off/loading area. You need to double park or park in the garage and then go check in. Room: Like I stated earlier, we were looking to save money. We had the smallest room, but it was enough. Any longer than a couple of nights might have been too much. But, we literally only slept and showered there as we spent all of our time outside of our room. Some minor points, they did have a safe, but it was locked. The sink was outside of the bathroom. And the towel rack was broken off. Oh well, we saved money here to spend it someplace else. This place wasn't bad to save money, but doesn't offer some niceties. If you're looking for a full-service hotel, go someplace else. If you want to save money and stay at a safe decent hotel, then stay here. Oh as for cleanliness, it was okay. My wife and I are very clean people and noted that this place wasn't the cleanest, but it was just ok. These are the places we at: Lunch: Koko's Pub (outside of Baltimore Inner Harbor area, but good crabcakes) Dinner: L.P. Steamers Dessert: Vaccaro's Breakfast: Miss Shirley's

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here ever again”
Reviews.Author: wed61502
Reviews.Content: i have written a blogspot to detail our trip and the pain this place brought our family. i hope you will be smart and read this blogspot. http://hatequalityinn.blogspot.com/ we had to change rooms 4 times never room ready by 2pm checkin

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time here"”
Reviews.Author: lmdarrington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, reserved our rooms at the beginning of August for an overnight stay on August 29th. Reservation was for a queen size room with check in at 2pm and check out at noon on Sunday. We arrived at 2:15 Sat. 8/29 to only 1 room being ready for check in. So we checked in and allowed the other couple to hang out with us til their room was ready. About 20 min. later they called up to let us know the other room was ready, at which time I requested to be moved to another room since the security lock on the door had been busted off, and I did not feel safe enough in that area, having been asked on the way in by a homeless person for money. They said they would not to keep us side by side, I explained that was fine with us, safety was more important to us. They moved us from room 204 to room 404 which that room did not have a security lock either. They said they would need some time, so we left our numbers for them to call us at since we had already spent over an hour trying to get rooms straight, and we had other things to do than to wait longer. They called around 4pm and said they had 2 rooms side by side ready and they have upgraded us to King rooms. We were very appeciative, and returned to get the rooms and put our things away before going to the baseball game, to arrive to once again only one room being ready. Son once again we placed everyones stuff into one room, checked the room that was not ready since the cleaner was in there cleaning to make sure locks were on the doors, and they were, so rooms looked great, after another 45 min. wait we left once again with both room keys in hand. Upon arriving back to the hotel after the game at 12:20am, to a notice posted on the only elevator door "Rooms 412 and 413 (with our names) please come to the front desk. What ever happened to guest privacy. The notice was so they could inform us that they had once again switched our rooms, because someone was already occupying room 412, (keep in mind we had already inspected the room earlier and there were no ones belongings in the room) so once again we had to move all of our belongings at 12:30 in the morning to another room. So in less than 24 hours in their hotel I had 4 different rooms. Not to mention that the staff was extremely rude, after requesting to be moved so I could sleep feeling safe, and I was asked only asked a total of 4 times in less than 24 hours for money by people loitering in front of the hotel. This was the worst experience I have ever had in my many years of traveling. Oh I forgot to mention that there was also no hotel manager available for us to speak to the entire time we were there. I must sum up my rating: the rooms even though extremely small (my sons room over a one car garage is bigger than the king size room bathroom included) were very clean once they were finally ready, the service sucked, the location is bad unless you don't mind people begging for money, value was ok for when we stayed, would not think of paying a penny more for the size of the room and service received, rooms once again extremely small.

Reviews.Title: “Staff goes the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: bjkkl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Baltimore and stayed at the Quality Inn downtown. It was great! It was clean and close to all the downtown attractions. We appreciated being able to get breakfast in the lobby in the mornings, something many downtown hotels don't include with their rate. The staff was friendly and went way beyond the call of duty! After checking out of the hotel we went to BWI via light rail to catch our flight home. Upon trying to check in at the airport, I discovered I had left my wallet (with ID) in our hotel room. With only one hour until time to board our flight, I called the hotel to check on my wallet. They checked the room and found it, however there was not enough time for me to make a round-trip from the airport to the hotel in time to catch our flight. The lady at the desk suggested that she could call a cab driver that she knew was very trustworthy and have him bring it to the airport for me. Wow! She did just that and my wallet arrived just in time for me to catch my flight home. The Quality Inn is a great place to stay with awesome, caring staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: D2559
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. rooms are extremely clean and heavy curtains are wonderful to make the night last into the morning! very quiet, though a/c was rather loud. I will outline the problems I had, but I still totally recommend this hotel. The price was great and the rooms were extremely clean, nicely decorated and a very short walk to the Harbor area. They also will soon be adding a lounge/bar off of the lobby. The problems though mostly revolved around the parking and unloading. There is no unloading area to get out luggage and go to check in and the closest parking facility closes very early. even earlier on weekend nights?? (at 6pm) I had a king room and it was a bit of a squeeze. the desk chair was over by room door as you couldn't actually put it in front of the desk lol

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: cxbonne
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel within close walking distance to Harbor Area. Room was very clean with modern decor. Bed was very comfortable and room very quiet. Got a great nights sleep because of the great blackout curtains. Highly recomended. Only improvements could be with morning staff being rude. This appears to be common in the South and East Coast however.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Slyke121203
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed at this hotel to see a baseball game at camden yards. When we arrived we were notified that there was not a room available with a double bed like reserved so we were upgraded to a Queen sized bed. So, we started off the stay well. When we went to our room it was very clean which is number 1 for me. My fiance enjoyed the plasma high def television. The beds in the room were very comfortable. I have to say I slept better there than I do at home! The rooms were quiet I did not hear any noise at all. The staff was also very friendly. My favorite part about the hotel is that it is in a great location. I felt safe at all times and the inner harbor and Camden Yards is only a short walk away. There is a continental breakfast which is nothing to write home about but it's food, and it's free, and convenient. The only negative part is the parking is a little bit inconvienient and somewhat expensive. Other than that, the whole experience was wonderful and I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Parking Nighmare!”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler3
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the parking arranagements for this hotel. We spent more in parking than our room rate. The room was clean, beds were hard, and it would be nice to have more than two towels when you stay with children. I was disappointed that at 9:30 there was no food left. There didn't seem as though anyone was willing to get more either. The cereal was empty, no bagels, toast, or even a muffin! Very diasappointing since you promote a continential breakfast. I would only recommend this hotel to a friend if you worked out a deal with the parking garage to hold spaces for your guests. We had to walk six blocks and paid 45.00 a night to park! Your hotel is under renovation, I'm sure it will be beautiful. People remember convenience, attitude, and cleanliness!

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn Downtown Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 110 Saint Paul Street, Baltimore, MD 21202
